text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 5.1.8, Courtesy Investigations.
5.1.8.1.1(1), clarified both Form 4759, Address Information Request - Postal Tracer, and Letter Letter to Verify Address, sent certified are needed prior to case transfer.

IRM 5.1.8.2, moved paragraph (9) to paragraph (2) to clarify assignments should be made to the group manager’s hold file; clarified in paragraph (3) Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands have a 45 day OI completion time frame; and, moved the bullets in paragraph (8) to paragraph (9) for instructions on transfer if receiving Area failed to timely complete the investigation.
IRM 5.1.8.5.1, added Federal Agency Delinquency (FAD) investigations, added IRM reference for probation and restitution cases, and added Collection Due Process/Equivalency Hearing (CDP/EH)
5.1.8.5.2(4), added clarification to contact taxpayer or qualified representative.
IRM 5.1.8.7.7, removed this section since guidance for incoming MCAR requests is now covered in IRM 5.21.7.4 Mutual Collection Assistance Requests.

) Purpose. This IRM section describes the process and procedures for issuing and working investigations from one area of assignment and/or operating to another assignment area. The assignments are made requesting in completing an investigation to resolve various case issues. (
) Audience. This IRM is designed for use by all personnel responsible for issuing and working Courtesy Investigations or Other Investigations (OI). (

) OIs can be assigned by one ICS user to another ICS user. This is accom- plished by creating an outgoing OI on ICS. The originator and the recipient share all detail and history information available on ICS. (

Substantive redetermination of tax — A substantive redetermination of tax involves a decision, no matter how cursory, the taxpayer’s tax liability is less than the amount previously assessed from that reported by the taxpayer on the return or from that determined in an examination. The Service abates down the redetermined tax liability, but the decision turns out to be incorrect and the tax must be assessed as tax under the Internal Revenue Code within the period of limitations on assessment. The Service may have to follow the deficiency procedures, after which the tax may be collected by administrative lien or levy action, or by offset under IRC
(a) (see IRM
